force:project:create.description:
create a Salesforce DX project
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

template.name: template
template.description: template to use for project creation

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: folder for saving the created files

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: generate a manifest (package.xml) for change-set based development

force:staticresource:create.description:
create a static resource
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

resourcename.name: resourcename
resourcename.description: name of the generated static resource

contenttype.name: contenttype
contenttype.description: content type (mime type) of the generated static resource

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: folder for saving the created files

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

force:apex:trigger:create.description:
create an Apex trigger
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
examples: $ sfdx force:apex:trigger:create -n MyTrigger -s Account -e 'before insert,after insert'

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

triggername.name: triggername
triggername.description: name of the generated Apex trigger

template.name: template
template.description: template to use for file creation

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: folder for saving the created files

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

sobject.name: sobject
sobject.description: sObject to create a trigger on

force:lightning:app:create.description:
create a Lightning app
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
If you don’t specify an outputdir, we create a subfolder in your current working directory with the name of your bundle. For example, if the current working directory is force-app and your Lightning bundle is called myBundle, we create force-app/myBundle/ to store the files in the bundle.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

appname.name: appname
appname.description: name of the generated Lightning app

template.name: template
template.description: template to use for file creation

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: folder for saving the created files

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

internal.name: internal
internal.description: create lightning bundles without creating a -meta.xml file

force:lightning:component:create.description:
create a bundle for an Aura component or a Lightning web component
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
If you don’t specify an outputdir, we create a subfolder in your current working directory with the name of your bundle. For example, if the current working directory is force-app and your Lightning bundle is called myBundle, we create force-app/myBundle/ to store the files in the bundle.

To create a Lightning web component, pass --type lwc to the command. If you don’t include a --type value, Salesforce CLI creates an Aura component by default.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

componentname.name: componentname
componentname.description: name of the generated Lightning component

template.name: template
template.description: template to use for file creation

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: folder for saving the created files

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

internal.name: internal
internal.description: create lightning bundles without creating a -meta.xml file
